The act of Moses in burning the calf and grinding it to powder, and making them drink of it, was to show them the utter worthlessness 
                                                                           280
of the god which they had been worshiping--that their god had no power at all. Men could burn it in the fire, grind it to powder and drink it without receiving any injury therefrom. He asked them how then could they expect such a god to save them, or do them any good, or any evil? Then he rehearsed to them the exhibitions which they had witnessed of the unlimited power, glory, and majesty of the living God.
